Reason: The 'memtable_cleanup_threshold' configuration is performance-sensitive. This is because the value of 'cleaningThreshold' directly impacts the behavior of the MemtablePool in the 'createMemtableAllocatorPool' method. The 'cleaningThreshold' is used to determine when to trigger a flush of the largest memtable based on the ratio of occupied non-flushing memtable size to total permitted size. This operation is time-expensive and memory-expensive as it involves flushing memtables, which can have a significant performance impact at the system level. Therefore, any changes to the 'memtable_cleanup_threshold' configuration can lead to notable performance variations in the system.
